position.marginalia_text: Discit hebdomas practica, quod non discit annus theoricus.

marginalia.translation: A week of practice will teach what a year of theory cannot.

position.marginalia_text: ( The onlie Quodlibetist in the World. )
Agit mensis Entelechia[e], quod non agit annus Industria[e].

marginalia.translation: The months of actualization does, what the year of industry does not.

position.marginalia_text: Viua demonstratio: et / Viuida entelechia. Singula ad rem: semper ad scopum.

marginalia.translation: A fresh demonstration: and a lively actualization. A singular thing towards the matter: always towards the goal.
Always the mind of a juvenile.

position.marginalia_text: Animus quò senior, eò iunior. diuinu[m] paradoxu[m]. Ingenium in senibus, solet esse multò, quàm in iuuenibus, viuacius, ac tractabilius. Luscinius de discenda a senibus Gra[e]ca Lingua.

book.title: Collectanea sacrosancta Grece discere cupientibus non aspernanda

marginalia.translation: The more senior the mind, the more junior [it is]. A divine paradox. The intellect in old people is accostomed to be more vigorous and manageable than in young people. Luscinius, on learning the Greek language from the wise men.

position.marginalia_text: ( Soli omniu[m] curandi libri, qui instanti negocio inseruiunt efficacissimè.)

marginalia.translation: Only books, which serve the interest of immediate business most effectively, must be cared for by all.

position.marginalia_text: In loquendo balbutire, infantia[e] est: in sermone vsq[uam] ha[e]rere, tarditatis. Vtrunq[ue] aut deficientis Natura[e]; aut simplicis ingenij; aut rudis facultatis. Pragmatici est ante omnes; dictis, factisq[ue] esse Expeditissimu[m].

marginalia.translation: It is part of children to babble in speaking: of slow people to hesitate in discussion in any place. Both are either deficiencies of nature, of a simple intellect, or of an unpolished faculty. To be a pragmatist is before all to be most expedient in saying and acting.

position.marginalia_text: Primum, vltimumq[ue] est dictis, factisq[ue] quam celerrime omnia expedire: nusq[uam] ha[e]rere: pla[e]raq[ue] mirificè pra[e]occupare: in res hominesq[ue]

marginalia.translation: The start and end is to obtain everything in saying and doing as most quickly: to hestitae on no occasion: to miraculously seize upon most things beforehand: to penetrate into matters of man and steel with a fiery spirit.

mark.name: bracket
mark.text: Che se'l contento manca, ogn'altra cosa Si dee poscia stimar sogni, ombre, & fumi.

mark.name: bracket
mark.text: Et che l'animo per contra, quanto piu si carichi si carichi d'anni, tanto piu d'intelligenza & di virtù, & di sapienza augumeuti & cresca.
